condition.description:
Cholesterol is a waxy, fat-like substance that occurs naturally in all parts of the body. Your body needs some cholesterol to work properly. But if you have too much in your blood, it can combine with other substances in the blood and stick to the walls of your arteries. This is called plaque. Plaque can narrow your arteries or even block them.

High levels of cholesterol in the blood can increase your risk of heart disease. Your cholesterol levels tend to rise as you get older. There are usually no signs or symptoms that you have high blood cholesterol, but it can be detected with a blood test. You are likely to have high cholesterol if members of your family have it, if you are overweight or if you eat a lot of fatty foods.

You can lower your cholesterol by exercising more and eating more fruits and vegetables. You also may need to take medicine to lower your cholesterol.

NIH: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute

basics.benefits_moa: Antara is a cholesterol-lowering medicine. It removes triglycerides from your body and makes it easier to process "bad" cholesterol (LDL). This also increases "good" cholesterol (HDL).
basics.bottom_line: Antara is good for lowering triglycerides (fats), but it's not as good as statins for improving cholesterol.
downsides: In studies, it didn't lower heart disease in people with Type 2 diabetes.
According to new guidelines, you shouldn't take this medicine by itself to lower cholesterol.
Drinking large amounts of alcohol regularly can raise your risk of liver damage.
Different forms and strengths of this medication can't be substituted for each other.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle pain
risks_warnings.description: People on Antara while taking statins have reported muscle pain which may lead to muscle and kidney damage. This has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain or weakness or fever and you don't know why.

basics.benefits_moa: Atorvastatin is cholesterol-lowering medicine called a statin. It lowers the amount of cholesterol your body makes, which helps lower "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and raise "good" cholesterol (HDL).
basics.bottom_line: Atorvastatin is a good medication to improve your cholesterol. Statin side effects can be difficult to deal with, but the benefits might outweigh the risks.
downsides: Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Eating a lot of grapefruit can raise your risk of liver damage.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

basics.benefits_moa: Crestor is cholesterol-lowering medicine called a statin. It lowers the amount of cholesterol your body makes, which helps lower "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and raise "good" cholesterol (HDL).
basics.bottom_line: Crestor is one of the most effective statins to improve cholesterol, but it's expensive. Statin side effects can be difficult to deal with, but the benefits might outweigh the risks.
downsides: There's no generic available, so it can be expensive.

Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

basics.bottom_line: Gemfibrozil is a generically available medication that can lower triglyceride levels by up to 50%.
downsides: While Gemfibrozil has been shown to lower triglycerides, it has not been shown by itself to reduce the number of deaths caused by high cholesterol.
Can't be used with statins to lower cholesterol because of the risk of muscle and kidney damage.

carousel_items: Psyllium works in about 12-72 hours for constipation.
It's important to take each dose with at least 8 ounces (a full glass) of water or other liquid (not hot liquids).
Mix powder well and drink right away up to 3 times a day (build up to this slowly), but not for more than one week.
Don't take Psyllium within 2 hours before or after taking other medicines. It may interact and affect how they work.
If you take Psyllium then have chest pain, vomiting, trouble breathing or swallowing, get medical help immediately.
Ask your doctor before taking Psyllium if you have stomach pain, nausea, vomiting or had sudden changes in your stool for more than 2 weeks.
Ask your doctor about giving Psyllium to anyone younger than 12 years.
Stop taking Psyllium and call your doctor if you have pain, swelling or bulging in your belly, rectal bleeding or have not had a bowel movement after taking.
Talk to you doctor about eating certain foods and getting more exercise to help prevent your constipation.

basics.benefits_moa: Psyllium is a fiber-based laxative. It adds bulk and moisture to your intestine, which softens stool and makes it easier to pass.
basics.bottom_line: The natural psyllium fiber in Psyllium does more than relieve constipation. It lowers cholesterol, keeps blood sugar levels healthy, and makes you feel less hungry between meals.
downsides: You may have to take Psyllium daily for 1-3 days to see full effects.
If you don't take it with enough liquid, it could swell, block your throat and cause choking.
Not the best choice for people who have swallowing problems or aren't able to drink lots of liquids.
Psyllium contains psyllium. Don't take if you have an allergy to psyllium from breathing it in or swallowing it.
Can cause gas and mild belly cramps.

Studies show it works better than a stool softener for constipation.

basics.benefits_moa: Pravastatin is cholesterol-lowering medicine called a statin. It lowers the amount of cholesterol your body makes, which helps lower "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and raise "good" cholesterol (HDL).
basics.bottom_line: Pravastatin can improve cholesterol, but it's not as strong as other statin medicines. Statin side effects can be difficult to deal with, but the benefits might outweigh the risks.
downsides: Not the best choice for people who have very high cholesterol levels.

Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

carousel_items: Take it in the evening.
Avoid grapefruit and grapefruit juice while taking this medicine.
Can cause headaches or diarrhea.
Call your doctor if you develop muscle pain.
Also taking Welchol or Questran? Take this medicine at least 2 hours before or 4 hours after.

basics.benefits_moa: Vytorin is a combination cholesterol-lowering medicine. Simvastatin prevents your body from making "bad" cholesterol (LDL) while raising "good" cholesterol (HDL). Ezetimibe prevents cholesterol absorption in your intestines.
basics.bottom_line: Vytorin is expensive and is no more effective than simvastatin by itself.
downsides: In clinical studies, simvastatin/ezetimibe hasn't controlled cholesterol better than simvastatin alone.
There's no generic available, so it can be expensive.

downsides_processed.orig: In clinical studies, simvastatin/ezetimibe hasn't controlled cholesterol better than simvastatin alone.
There's no generic available, so it can be expensive.

upsides: A 2-in-1 cholesterol-lowering combination medicine.
Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.

upsides_processed.orig: A 2-in-1 cholesterol-lowering combination medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle pain
risks_warnings.description: People on Vytorin have reported muscle pain which may lead to muscle breakdown and kidney damage, especially in people of Asian ancestry who are also taking niacin. This has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you suddenly develop muscle pain and a fever and you don't know why.

description_processed.orig: People on Vytorin have reported muscle pain which may lead to muscle breakdown and kidney damage, especially in people of Asian ancestry who are also taking niacin. This has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you suddenly develop muscle pain and a fever and you don't know why.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: People who take Vytorin have reported liver damage, especially if taken with statins or if you drink large amounts of alcohol. This has been rare. Talk to your doctor if you've ever had liver disease as they may discuss alternatives, or they may monitor your liver with blood tests.

description_processed.orig: People who take Vytorin have reported liver damage, especially if taken with statins or if you drink large amounts of alcohol. This has been rare. Talk to your doctor if you've ever had liver disease as they may discuss alternatives, or they may monitor your liver with blood tests.

risks_warnings.title: High blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: People with diabetes may have increases in their blood sugar levels while taking Vytorin, especially during the first few months of taking this medication. Your doctor will work closely with you to see if changes to your diabetes medications are needed.

description_processed.orig: People with diabetes may have increases in their blood sugar levels while taking Vytorin, especially during the first few months of taking this medication. Your doctor will work closely with you to see if changes to your diabetes medications are needed.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for colds and flu
risks_warnings.description: People on Vytorin have reported getting colds or the flu more often. If you find this bothersome, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: People on Vytorin have reported getting colds or the flu more often. If you find this bothersome, talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Skin reactions
risks_warnings.description: People on Vytorin have reported serious skin reactions, which may lead to death. This has been very rare. Contact your doctor immediately if you develop a sudden fever and a blistering rash.

description_processed.orig: People on Vytorin have reported serious skin reactions, which may lead to death. This has been very rare. Contact your doctor immediately if you develop a sudden fever and a blistering rash.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Talk to your doctor if you are pregnant or considering pregnancy, as Vytorin may cause harm to the fetus, including death. Your prescriber will discuss alternatives for you.

description_processed.orig: Talk to your doctor if you are pregnant or considering pregnancy, as Vytorin may cause harm to the fetus, including death. Your prescriber will discuss alternatives for you.

Tell your doctor if you develop bone or muscle pain.
Can be used with other medications to lower cholesterol.
May cause diarrhea or raise your chance of getting colds.

basics.benefits_moa: Zetia is a cholesterol-lowering medicine. It prevents cholesterol absorption in your intestines, lowers the amount of cholesterol stored in your liver, and helps your body process cholesterol.
basics.bottom_line: Zetia can improve your cholesterol, but it doesn't reduce heart attacks or heart disease, and it's expensive compared to other cholesterol-lowering medicines.
downsides: Doesn't lower triglycerides (fats).
Hasn't been shown to lower the risk of heart attacks or heart disease.
By itself, Zetia is not as effective as statins for improving cholesterol.
There's no generic available, so it can be expensive.

downsides_processed.orig: Doesn't lower triglycerides (fats).

There's no generic available, so it can be expensive.

Can be used with other medicines to improve cholesterol.
Available in a combination pill with simvastatin.

carousel_items: Increase the amount of Benefiber you take slowly to prevent gas and diarrhea.
Be sure to drink water each day to help avoid constipation.
The Benefiber powder dissolves in any liquid, but don't add it to carbonated drinks.
Fiber can affect how medications work, so be sure to take Benefiber 1 hour before or 2 hours after you take other medications.
Can cause bloating, gas, or stomach cramps.

basics.benefits_moa: Benefiber is a natural fiber. It improves digestive health by softening and bulking stool while increasing good bacteria in the colon.
basics.bottom_line: Benefiber is an excellent fiber supplement. It's easy to use and doesn't clump up like other supplements.
downsides: If you have a gluten intolerance, celiac disease, are pregnant, or are nursing, check with your doctor before taking Benefiber.
Taking too much Benefiber can cause constipation, gas, and bloating.
Benefiber doesnâ€™t bulk up stool as much as insoluble fiber supplements.
Some people's bodies can become dependent on fiber supplements.

downsides_processed.orig: If you have a gluten intolerance, celiac disease, are pregnant, or are nursing, check with your doctor before taking Benefiber.

Benefiber doesnâ€™t bulk up stool as much as insoluble fiber supplements.
Some people's bodies can become dependent on fiber supplements.

upsides: Research shows soluble fibers like Benefiber are useful for people who donâ€™t meet daily fiber recommendations.
Benefiber completely dissolves in liquids and doesnâ€™t have a gritty texture like other similar fiber supplements.
Comes in multiple forms, including chewables, powders, and caplets.
Should cause less gas and bloating than other fiber supplements.
Has multiple health benefits including lower blood sugar and cholesterol levels.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Increase the amount of Benefiber you take slowly to prevent gas and diarrhea.
Be sure to drink water each day to help avoid constipation.
The Benefiber powder dissolves in any liquid, but don't add it to carbonated drinks.
Fiber can affect how medications work, so be sure to take Benefiber 1 hour before or 2 hours after you take other medications.

risks_warnings.title: Warnings
risks_warnings.description: Benefiber and soluble fiber supplements are not recommended to be used with carbonated beverages. Be cautious using it if you have kidney stones, are pregnant, or are nursing.

description_processed.orig: Benefiber and soluble fiber supplements are not recommended to be used with carbonated beverages. Be cautious using it if you have kidney stones, are pregnant, or are nursing.

risks_warnings.title: Fiber intake
risks_warnings.description: Gradually increase the amount of Benefiber you take over a few days, as recommended in the instructions. Suddenly adding increased amounts of fiber to your diet too quickly can lead to gas, diarrhea, bloating, cramping, and discomfort. Taking more than 50 mg of fiber daily can cause intestinal blockage and fluid imbalance.

description_processed.orig: Gradually increase the amount of Benefiber you take over a few days, as recommended in the instructions. Suddenly adding increased amounts of fiber to your diet too quickly can lead to gas, diarrhea, bloating, cramping, and discomfort. Taking more than 50 mg of fiber daily can cause intestinal blockage and fluid imbalance.

risks_warnings.title: Medication interactions
risks_warnings.description: Fiber supplements like can interact with medications. Be sure to talk to your doctor before starting Benefiber if you take antidepressant medications, diabetes medications, carbamazepine, cholesterol-lowering medications, or penicillin.

description_processed.orig: Fiber supplements like can interact with medications. Be sure to talk to your doctor before starting Benefiber if you take antidepressant medications, diabetes medications, carbamazepine, cholesterol-lowering medications, or penicillin.

basics.benefits_moa: Trilipix is a cholesterol-lowering medicine. It removes triglycerides from your body and makes it easier to process "bad" cholesterol (LDL). This also increases "good" cholesterol (HDL).
basics.bottom_line: Trilipix is good for lowering triglycerides (fats), but it's not as good as statins for improving cholesterol and cardiovascular disease risk.
downsides: In clinical studies, Trilipix hasn't lowered cholesterol or the risk of heart attack and stroke better than statins.
Different forms and strengths of this medication can't be substituted for each other.

downsides_processed.orig: In clinical studies, Trilipix hasn't lowered cholesterol or the risk of heart attack and stroke better than statins.
Different forms and strengths of this medication can't be substituted for each other.

upsides: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides (fats) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.
Good medicine for lowering triglycerides.

Good medicine for lowering triglycerides.

risks_warnings.description: Reports of liver damage have been reported in people who take Trilipix, especially in people with a history of liver disease. Your doctor may monitor your liver with blood tests on a regular basis.

risks_warnings.title: Gallstones
risks_warnings.description: People on Trilipix have reported gallstones while on this medication. Talk to your doctor if you develop sudden abdominal pain.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding risk
risks_warnings.description: People on anticoagulants such as Coumadin while on Trilipix may have increased INR/PT on blood tests, which may mean increased bleeding risk. Tell your doctor if you are on anticoagulants, as they may have to monitor your blood and adjust your medications.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in blood tests

carousel_items: Take Gemfibrozil two times a day, 30 minutes before your breakfast and dinner.
Don't drink alcohol while taking this medication.
Can cause heartburn, stomach pain, and diarrhea.
Follow a diet and exercise plan to help lower your triglyceride and cholesterol levels.

basics.benefits_moa: Gemfibrozil is a fibric acid medication that lowers the levels of triglycerides in your blood, while raising the levels of good cholesterols.
basics.bottom_line: Gemfibrozil is a generically available medication that can lower triglyceride levels by up to 50%.
downsides: While Gemfibrozil has been shown to lower triglycerides, it has not been shown by itself to reduce the number of deaths caused by high cholesterol.
Can't be used with statins to lower cholesterol because of the risk of muscle and kidney damage.

downsides_processed.orig: While Gemfibrozil has been shown to lower triglycerides, it has not been shown by itself to reduce the number of deaths caused by high cholesterol.
Can't be used with statins to lower cholesterol because of the risk of muscle and kidney damage.

upsides: Considered as a first choice medication for lowering triglyceride levels in the blood. Studies have shown it can reduce triglycerides by up to 50%.
Available as a generic.
Can be used with other medications, such as fish oil, to lower bad cholesterol and increase good cholesterol.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle pain
risks_warnings.description: People on Gemfibrozil while taking statins have reported muscle pain which may lead to muscle and kidney damage. This has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain or weakness or fever and you don't know why.

description_processed.orig: People on Gemfibrozil while taking statins have reported muscle pain which may lead to muscle and kidney damage. This has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain or weakness or fever and you don't know why.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Reports of liver damage have been reported in people who take Gemfibrozil, especially in people with a history of liver disease. Your doctor may monitor your liver with blood tests on a regular basis.

description_processed.orig: Reports of liver damage have been reported in people who take Gemfibrozil, especially in people with a history of liver disease. Your doctor may monitor your liver with blood tests on a regular basis.

risks_warnings.title: Gallstones
risks_warnings.description: People on Gemfibrozil have reported gallstones while on this medication. Contact your prescriber if you develop sudden abdominal pain.

description_processed.orig: People on Gemfibrozil have reported gallstones while on this medication. Contact your prescriber if you develop sudden abdominal pain.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding risk
risks_warnings.description: People on anticoagulants such as Coumadin while on Gemfibrozil may have increased INR/PT on blood tests, which may mean increased bleeding risk. Tell your doctor if you are on anticoagulants, as they may have to monitor your blood and adjust your medications.

risks_warnings.description: Reports of decreased red blood cell and white blood cell counts have been seen in people on Gemfibrozil. Your doctor may check your blood.

clock.tip: Take with evening meal and avoid grapefruit juice.
Take with food and avoid grapefruit juice.

basics.benefits_moa: Lovastatin is cholesterol-lowering medicine called a statin. It lowers the amount of cholesterol your body makes, which helps lower "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and raise "good" cholesterol (HDL).
basics.bottom_line: Lovastatin can improve cholesterol, but it's not as strong as other statin medicines. Statin side effects can be difficult to deal with, but the benefits might outweigh the risks.
downsides: Not the best choice for people who have very high cholesterol levels.

Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

downsides_processed.orig: Not the best choice for people who have very high cholesterol levels.

Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides (fats) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.
Can lower the risk of heart attack, stroke, and death, particularly if you have diabetes, high blood pressure, obesity, or a history of smoking.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle pain
risks_warnings.description: There are rare cases of muscle damage leading to kidney failure in people taking Lovastatin. The risk is greater in people with kidney disease or thyroid disease, are older and female and taking certain cholesterol-lowering medication combinations. Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness or fever and there is no known cause.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of liver damage in people who take Lovastatin, especially if they are heavy alcohol drinkers or have a history of liver disease. If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, tell your doctor. Your doctor may also want to check your liver function periodically.

userStories.tip: You need to monitor Creatinine Clearance because - even though you may not experience muscle pain - all statins can cause rhabdymylosis (a form of muscle wasting) in a percentage of users. The waste product is excreted through the kidneys.
Try to take at bedtime for the best results.

Pravastatin lowered my cholesterol numbers significantly, but I'm not entirely convinced of the necessity of long-term, maintenance-dose statins for a person with my blood numbers. Also, at first I would feel tired and slow-witted.
